content: This lesson was really helpful! The explanation of HTML document structure is clear and easy to follow. I especially appreciated the examples showing proper semantic markup.
Could you provide more examples of when to use different semantic elements? I'm still confused about the difference between article and section tags.
The CSS selector examples were fantastic. The visual demonstrations really helped me understand specificity and cascade rules.
Great lesson on HTML elements! The interactive examples made it easy to practice. Looking forward to the next module on CSS.
The Python introduction is well-structured. I like how you connect the concepts to data science applications right from the beginning.
This lesson on user research techniques is eye-opening. I never realized how important empathy mapping is in the design process.
The video quality could be improved. Sometimes it's hard to see the code examples clearly, especially on mobile devices.
